summary: This document is a series of email exchanges between the chambers of Judge Alison J. Nathan and various attorneys regarding the case United States v. Maxwell (20 Cr. 330). The emails concern procedural matters, including a request to add an unnamed individual as a 'movant' to the Electronic Case Filing (ECF) system and the submission of a letter related to a Rule 17(c) subpoena.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: Presiding judge in the case United States v. Maxwell; her chambers are issuing memo endorsements and communicating with counsel.

persons.name: Brian Burns
persons.context: Attorney from Smith Villazor LLP submitting letters to the court on behalf of an unnamed client, including a request to add that client as a 'movant' and a letter regarding a Rule 17(c) subpoena.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Copied on email correspondence among counsel in the case.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Copied on email correspondence among counsel in the case.

persons.name: Patrick Smith
persons.context: Attorney whose letter regarding a Rule 17(c) subpoena is being submitted to the court by Brian Burns; copied on emails.

persons.name: Bobbi C. Sternheim
persons.context: Attorney from the Law Offices of Bobbi C. Sternheim who confirms receipt of a memo endorsement from the court.

connections.description: Brian Burns is submitting a letter from Patrick J. Smith to the court, indicating they are working together on a legal matter related to the case.
Brian Burns is an attorney communicating with and making requests to Judge Nathan's court.
Bobbi Sternheim is an attorney confirming receipt of a court order from Judge Nathan's chambers.

events.title: Submission of Rule 17(c) Subpoena Letter
events.description: Attorney Brian Burns submits a letter from Patrick J. Smith to Judge Nathan regarding a Rule 17(c) subpoena in the case United States v. Maxwell.

events.title: Court Issues Temporarily Sealed Memo Endorsement
events.description: Judge Nathan's chambers issues a temporarily sealed memo endorsement to counsel in the case.

events.title: Request to Add 'Movant' to ECF
events.description: Attorney Brian Burns submits a letter requesting that an unnamed individual be added to the Electronic Case Filing system as a 'movant' to file papers.

events.title: Court Issues Public Memo Endorsement
events.description: Judge Nathan's chambers issues a memo endorsement that will be filed on the public docket.

keyFacts: The document pertains to ongoing procedural actions in the criminal case United States v. Maxwell (20 Cr. 330).
An unnamed individual, represented by attorney Brian Burns, is seeking to be added as a 'movant' to the case's Electronic Case Filing system.
Attorney Patrick J. Smith has a letter regarding a Rule 17(c) subpoena that was submitted to the court.
Judge Alison J. Nathan's chambers is actively managing communications and issuing orders, including a temporarily sealed memo.
The correspondence involves multiple law firms: Smith Villazor LLP and the Law Offices of Bobbi C. Sternheim.
